definition[0]: a country in East Africa between Kenya and Mozambique, formed in 1964 when Tanganyika and Zanzibar joined together to make one country. Population: 48,261,942 (2014). Capital: Dodoma. Most of the government departments are located in the country's largest city, Dar es Salaam, which is also the country's major port (=place where ships are loaded and unloaded). In 1998 a terrorist bomb exploded at the US embassy, killing many Tanzanians.
